Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 02:05PM Journey-Girl wrote: Susan & Goldie...  you girls look awesome !   Thanks for pics.  Helps me understand what to expect (growth wise).   Lisa 1964 - It's coming girl..  all of a sudden your going to have a growth spurt. As for me... on the other side.   Haven't lost mine yet.  Day 12 since first chemo.  I'm just hoping hoping hoping to make it through this weekend with hair...  : )
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2009 09:43PM Journey-Girl wrote: Renee Jean and the rest of the sistas: The day I had to shave my head was without a doubt one of the most emotional days of my life.  My hair was long (about 3-4 inches past shoulders) and blonde (fake of course).   I cried for the longest time, and even now can tear up just thinking about that awful day.  Okay now for my "hair" news...   I am still doing chemo, (I do once a week, every Monday) and have only two left (so exciting, I practically pee myself thinking about it)     So two days ago I could swear I felt nubs under my arms.  I looked under there this morning and OMG I actually have hairs.. that I need to shave !!!!!    Just a few under each arm, but honestly, you would think I just won the lottery.  Can't wait to get in that ol' shower and actually use my razor again.  Who would have ever thought we could actually get excited about arm pit hair ???!!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2010 05:26PM Journey-Girl wrote: It's been a while since I've been on the boards.. I finished chemo in November (10 months) ago and rads in February.  I was on Herceptin until end of May.  I always had very straight fine/thin blonde hair.  My hair has grown in straight and lots of it !  I still can't believe how much hair I have..  I used (and still do) every product anyone mentioned (Nioxin, Nioxin scalp booster, Biotin supplements).  The lashes and brows came back (lashes fell out twice).  I think they (the lashes) took too long to grow in.  But they do.  When my lashes were long enough (stubs) I used the individual lashes for a few months until they grew back to normal looking.   That being said, know this.  you are all perfectly beautiful as you are right at this moment.  And when that's sunk in, use eyeliner, hides the no lash look!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2009 01:26AM Journey-Girl wrote: Love this thread !  I am on the other side.. expecting my hair to fall out any day now.  I am 10 days out from my first chemo treatment. Nodapearl - you go girl !  You inspire us all. Bold - Would love to have seen the gold head.. no pics ? Chainey - you are adorable, and you are rocking the hair. Chelev - what did you hear/read about Black Cohesh ?  I used that for hot flashes when I was in the throes of menopause and it worked awesome.  I know I can't take any herbs while undergoing chemo, but so many write that the hot flashes just keep on coming, even when chemo stops.  Figured I would just start popping the BC pills again.    Also, your sister... I don't even know what to say.  I just feel so bad that for you on that one.  Ball is definetely in her court though, you've reached out enough.     I'll keep reading this thread - know what to expect when I come out the other end of chemo hell.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 27, 2009 09:37PM Journey-Girl wrote: I just started chemo... one week ago.  W-a-i-t-i-n-g for the first hair to come out.. and I'm so-o-o sad about it.  I love my hair.  Freaking out about the eyelashes/eyebrows.  Like losing our hair isn't enough?!!  I'm on a journey I don't want to take - so glad to have all these threads to help me get through.

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 07:20PM Journey-Girl wrote: I too was yanked off Taxotere.  Had a bad reaction the first round and really severe reaction on TX #2.  I start the Abraxane on Thursday (25th).   I have been poking around here on this site trying to find others who have done the Abraxane cocktail also..   Please keep me up-to-date on how you handle it and I will do the same.   I did meet someone (on this site) who did the Abraxane cocktail and she let me know how her SE's were (pretty much down two days a week), but we'll see how we do.      Joni
Posts.Title: Taxol vs Taxotere pep671 PositivityRocks

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2009 01:02AM Journey-Girl wrote: Day 20 for me, and I'm still with hair... though shedding like a dog.  I had my friend give me a cute little bob haircut and while the hair is thinning daily, I definetly still have enough hair to not feel like I have to shave it (yet)!   I have my second chemo treatment tomorrow, I figure that will  certainly cause what I have left to fall out.   : )
Posts.Title: Does everyone loose their hair during TC chemo myagirl Sharon648

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 11:31PM Journey-Girl wrote: Today is my day 14..   Everyday I give my hair a little tug and am so happy that it is firmly in place.  Took a shower last night and when I got out gave a gentle tug.  And sure enough my hair was still firmly in place.  Had not lost even one little 'ol strand.   This morning woke up (again, day number 14) gave a gentle little tug and ... HOLY CRAP!  it just tugged right out of my scalp.  I just sat there stunned, looking at my hair in my hand.   And this is how my day has gone.  The hair is just gently coming out.     : (
Posts.Title: Does everyone loose their hair during TC chemo myagirl Sharon648
